_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This facility receives Carbon Dioxide as a byproduct of ammonia production from The Eldorado Chemical Company located in Eldorado AR.. The Carbon Dioxide is purified, compressed and refrigerated into

liquid form and the liquid Carbon dioxide is stored under pressure as a refrigerated liquid. The

facility also manufactures and processes various forms of solid Carbon Dioxide (dry ice). Ammonia

is used as the refrigerant in a closed loop Ammonia refrigeration system located on the facility. An

ammonia receiver stores the Ammonia refrigerant in addition to various heat exchangers,

compressors, condensers and connecting piping and valves.

Our worst case scenario for ammonia system is a failure of the ammonia receiver resulting in the

release of ammonia.The quantity of the release is estimated to be 17,850lb of ammonia over a 10

minute period of time with most stable of atmospheric conditions which minimizes dispersion of a

release and thus the worst case of quantity released and worst case due to atmospheric conditions.

The calculated toxic endpoint of which the concentration is calculated not to exceed 200ppm is 2.6

miles. These calculations were based on the EPA's "Risk Management Program Guidance for

Ammonia Refrigeration." Public receptors identified within 2.6 miles of the facility include

residences, schools and commercial/industrial areas. There is an estimated population of 12,073 that

could be affected by the worst case scenario.

An alternate release scenario was also calculated using EPA guidelines. A leak from a pipe, pump or

vessel was assumed to create a release rate of 200lb per minute. The atmospheric condition are

assumed to be more typical of the area and the toxic endpoint of which the ammonia concentration

is calculated not to exceed 200ppm is 0.3 miles. Again, calculations were based on the

EPA's "Risk Management Guidelines fro Ammonia Refrigeration." Public receptors within 0.3 miles

of the facility include  commercial/industrial

facilities. There is an estimated

population of 0 that could be affected by the alternate case scenario.

This is a new facility with all refrigeration components being made within ASME, IIAR and ASHRAE

specifications.The system was also thoroughly inspected and tested by Certified Mechanical

Integrity Inspector prior to starting the system.

In the event of an Ammonia release, the plant has developed an emergency response plan and

procedure. If necessary, the Eldorado Fire Department will be contacted and emergency response

procedures will be coordinated with the Eldorado Fire Department and the Union County LEPC

and any other local authorities in order to most effectively protect our employees, our property and

our community.
